p: Today aromatherapy, a branch of phytotherapy, is gaining momentum as complementary therapy to the traditional medicine [ 5]. Aromatherapy uses essential oils via inhalation or massage as the main therapeutic agents to treat several diseases. The inhalation of volatile aromatic substances extracted from plants can affect the mood and state of health of the person by inducing psychological and physical effects [ 6â€“ 10]. The transdermal and transmucosal application of essential oils also concerns the phytotherapy [ 11].
